topic.title: There is no good e-mail option
topic.body:
Tutanota:
>no bridge, can't use your own mail client
>does not encrypt subject lines because that hasn't been standardized yet (standardization or privacy - which is more important?)
>based in fucking germany of all places
>run by SJWs?

Protonmail:
>proprietary bridge (requires subscription of at least $48/year if you want to use it). Only unofficial bridge is buggy/unworkable.
>the unofficial bridge barely works anyway
>planning to open source in 6 months (they said, one year ago).

Fuck email.

1566165386_14g2gXnsZdEPShFJkGdh5W3eGXmKz.body: download tachiyomi and look at the catalouges section. The world is yours to read.

1569889390_1NVmsWAF88eiamogSRiUzzSVKbsak.body:
> [petrina](#comment_24_1GFU4qAMTFnQJ7W7r98Zj2xJWq1evoN7Fz): Glad you think so, would not want to share a mail server with a moron like you.

Great arguments, retard.

1569725313_1JbYWzY92aoLHfoCKnhnEUekcEbbe.body: You'll need a time machine. You can set it to any date prior to ~50 years ago.

1546815090_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnX.body:
Basically, make sure the file is readable by the tor group and make sure your user account is part of the tor group.

Check permissions on the file with ls -l
Check your groups with the id command

1590855688_13ynUw2jD5FnBomqnq5vENr5ioWY7.body:
> [xcape2net](#comment_744_1GJc2vm4vJjAKsFoFJ2D3gGmKiRac2kfnz): Aether looks interesting.  How many people use it?

haven't used it but I'll put in on my to-try list.
